content.title: It is known that in the eyes of men, women look more attractive during ovulation. Now, doctors from the German University of GÃ¶ttingen have identified a link between a woman's posture and the phase of her fertility.

content.text: When women ovulate, posture and movement subtly change, scientists describe the results of their experiments in an interview with LiveScience. Men seem to read information from a woman's movements about whether she can get pregnant today.

The researchers conducted an experiment in which 48 women from 19 to 33 years old had to dance to the same musical composition. Frames depicting them in the form of processed, traced silhouettes (to reduce differences in appearance) were shown to 200 men.
They only had to select the most attractive women in their opinion, based on the dance steps of the silhouettes. At the same time, they selected exactly those women who were at the peak of ovulation.

This made it possible for scientists to make an assumption about the relationship between estrogen changes in the female body and the condition of the muscles and ligaments. Most likely, the authors of the study say in interviews, these hormonal changes affect a woman's motor reflexes in a special way.
